titles.title: Third Higher Education Extension Act of 2007
To temporarily extend the programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.
Mr. Hinojosa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3927.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

bill.summary: 10/23/2007--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Third Higher Education Extension Act of 2007 - Amends the Higher Education Extension Act of 2005 to extend the programs under the Higher Education Act of 1965 through April 30, 2008.
